title: Determining the Right Time to Take Out a Student Loan
text:
Determining the Right Time to Take Out a Student Loan Written by: Ellen Chang 09/08/15 - 2:43 PM EDT 
NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) â€” Figuring out the right time to obtain a student loan depends on many factors, especially if you are a Millennial or Gen X-er headed back for another degree. 
The majority of student loans are offered to coincide with the academic year right before the fall and spring semesters begin. Lenders will also work with students attending colleges on a quarter system. 
While many students are locked into obtaining a loan to pay for tuition during the requisite fall and spring months, lenders tend to become more competitive as you get closer to the first day of classes. Many will start offering incentives and reduce interest rates for private loans, said Patrick Kandianis, co-founder of Valore, the Boston textbook seller and renter which also owns SimpleTuition, a student loan comparison engine.
